content: Prior to 1996, health insurance coverage for mental illness was historically less generous than for physical illnesses, with lower limits, fewer covered services, and increased cost sharing. Prior to the enactment of federal mental health parity laws, health plans imposed lower limits and fewer services for mental health coverage compared to medical and surgical services. Mental health parity aims to address this insurance coverage disparity by ensuring equal coverage for mental health services.
